thread.title: Weak China data sends market lower
thread.title_full: Weak China data sends market lower

title: Weak China data sends market lower
text:
Tue, Sep 1, 2015, 2:17 PM AEST - Australia Markets close in 1 hr 43 mins Weak China data sends market lower AAP – 2 hours 2 minutes ago Recommend Print 
The share market has tumbled as new data shows further signs of a weakening Chinese economy. 
An official measure of Chinese manufacturing activity fell to a three-year low in August, indicating the sector contracted in the month. 
Local shares were already lower, and took an even sharper plunge just before noon on the news from China. 
All sectors of the market were in negative territory, with all four big banks more than one per cent weaker and the key miners between one and four per cent lower. 
KEY FACTS 
* At 1200 AEST, the benchmark S&P/ASX200 index was down 59.8 points, or 1.15 per cent, at 5,147.2 points. 
* The broader All Ordinaries index was down 56.5 points, or 1.08 per cent, to 5,165.6 points. 
* The September share price index futures contract was down 47 points at 5,120, with 20,285 contracts traded. 
* National turnover was 823 million securities worth $2.25 billion. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Labor's bank levy 'dead': Abbott AAP 
The Abbott government has dumped a Labor initiative to impose a bank deposit levy. "Labor's bank deposit is dead," …
